author: BOBBY CAINA CALVAN
description: HELENA, Mont. (AP) — A reporter said the Republican candidate for Montana's sole congressional seat body-slammed him Wednesday, the day before the polls close in the nationally watched special election. Greg Gianforte was in a private office giving an interview when Guardian newspaper reporter Ben Jacobs came in without permission, campaign spokesman Shane Scanlon said. In an audio recording posted by the Guardian, the reporter asks the congressional candidate about the GOP's health care bill, which was just evaluated hours earlier by the Congressional Budget Office.
title: Reporter alleges GOP hopeful Greg Gianforte body-slammed him

author: https://www.facebook.com/hadas.gold
description: “Get the hell out of here,” Greg Gianforte is heard yelling.
title: Reporter: Montana House GOP candidate  'body-slammed' me

author: Seaborn Larson
description: A reporter for the Guardian was allegedly assaulted by Greg Gianforte, the Republican candidate in the Montana U.S. House race, the reporter said via Twitter.
title: Reporter alleges he was ‘body slammed’ by Montana GOP candidate

author: Julia Carrie Wong, Sam Levin
description: Audio obtained of Greg Gianforte attacking a reporter on eve of special election to fill a congressional seat vacated by a member of the Trump administration
title: Republican candidate 'body-slams' Guardian reporter in Montana

author: Leslie Shaffer
description: A Guardian reporter said Montana Republican candidate Greg Gianforte allegedly “body slammed” him in a taped interview. The campaign disputed the description.
title: Republican candidate in Montana special election allegedly assaults Guardian reporter

author: https://www.facebook.com/daveweigel?fref=ts
description: The Gallatin County sheriff's office said it was “investigating allegations of an assault involving Greg Gianforte.” The Republican candidate's spokesman blames “aggressive behavior from a liberal journalist."
title: Republican candidate in Montana race allegedly ‘body-slammed’ reporter, prompting police investigation
